Posts.Content: Dec 30, 2008 08:32PM MelissaMF wrote: I can relate to on going frustation to recovering from surgery.    I had a masectomy of my LB on 9/29 and they did reconstruction using the the latissimus dorsi flap method, which took my back muscle out.  I ended up with 2 infections and my back incision split open.  I still have pain in my left side, chest, arm, and back and now have thrombosis in my arm. I've been back to work full time since 11/17 and have 3 girls at home still to take care of.  I come home from work every night in major pain. It was my first mammo..I went because I was 40.  I was in great shape, so I thought I would have rebounded right back, since my PS said the recovery would have been about 4 weeks.  I just checked out this website today and saw all of your comments and see how some of you have struggled and think that everyone does heal differently.  But I really feel like a whiner when I leave the doctor's office because I am not 100% yet.  I'm on tamoxifen and was wondering if that is contributing to me not healing as well.  I'm finally getting my expander out on 1/27 and the permanent implant in under the back muscle that is now covering it.  I am hoping that will relieve some of my chest pain.  Has anyone had this procedure and dealt with any of this?  I am so frustrated. Melissa

Posts.Content: Feb 14, 2009 06:51PM MelissaMF wrote: I had my surgery last September and am still in pain.   I had a couple of infections after my surgery and the doctors kept acting like my body just didn't do well with the surgery.   Although I had a mastectomey with reconstruction and you are talking about a lumectomy, I am concerned you may have the same problem I do.  They think  I have nerve damage from my surgery.   My chest, arm, and back hurt constantly.  They hurt even more if I do things.  I would ask them to see if that is a possibility.  It didn't click with my surgeon until he did my expander surgery a couple of weeks ago and I woke up from it crying in pain.  My arm and chest were killing me...and he didn't even touch my arm.  That's when he realized something must be wrong and he's sure it is nerve damage.  I put a question on this discussion board about nerve damage..so you will see some of the other ladies' responses to what they experienced.  I'd keep pushing it with your doctor.  Try to see a pain management specialist.  That is where I am headed next.  Good luck!
